embeds.title: Rye Stalk
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

At the start of each combat, all enemies lose 2 **Strength** :p_strength:.
*Still in mint condition, despite being chewed on for so long.*

messages.content: this relic description is outdated
rye stalk edition 17
all class now too

its not that great right now, compare it to centennial puzzle which draws 3 all at once and can be triggered on your turn. Rye stalk can help you when you are losing group fights and is pretty good vs the heart (the one thing it has in common with it's older self).  Its middle of the road as far as rare relics go. Drawing cards is always going to be useful but it cant reach the peaks that stronger rare relics can.
Absolute trash rework
Why is it not common? who knows!
idk this would be way to good on a common
Like its just a bad <centennial puzzle> 9/10 times 💀

messages.content: body armor is a dead on card
don't pretend that you're actively drafting pain as hermit
I mean in the sense of "double dips on dex, you can get rid of doubts"
you want the doubt for the strength.
before you find/draw determination
magnum is not a curse card either just because it synergizes with fatal desire btw
I don’t take this new rye stalk
not ever
I suddenly thought 1 temp STR when attacked but that’s just mad gremlin
but it would be great for scaling with determination against Heart

I guess I'm the odd one out here, but I've had pretty good experiences with the current iteration of this relic and I think it's in a fine spot. It's not strictly worse than centennial puzzle, since this can be triggered multiple times in one fight, and the draw is more spaced out between turns. Centennial puzzle is also just a very strong relic, especially for a common, as a way to help accelerate against shield and spear (as well as solve their dangerous turn 2 burns) and the heart. Being situationally less good than an excellent relic that probably should be rarer than it is doesn't make rye stalk bad. Note that a multihit or multiple enemies hitting you in a turn will trigger multiple draws. Quite powerful, and works very nicely with rugged or apparitions to take only a small amount of damage but still get the draw. You will definitely want to look for opportunities to just under block with this, as taking 1 damage is well worth drawing an extra card next turn, and this relic is quite strong if it's providing +1 draw throughout an entire fight (comparable to ring of the serpent). Gets a little easier to use it in that way if you have some sustain relics to counteract the chip damage you're taking.

I do agree that it's current effect is a little boring, and not necessarily thematically fitting for hermit. I really liked the version that gave you a free flash powder, since it gave significant mitigation throughout fights, and was a very good way to help protect rugged and plated armor against difficult multihit enemies and bosses. It was however basically a snap purchase any time you saw it, because the effect was so generically good.
I do agree that this relic is being overhated a little bit. But I don't take back me saying that its just "middle of the road"
some rare relics raise your floor, others raise your ceiling... this one does neither

It draws cards, sometimes. Rye stalk suffers from not being at its best most of the time. You arent able to consistently take 1 or 2 damage intentionally to get the draw for next turn. You are almost always going to be over or underblocking.
and there are no re-useable sources of rugged
hence why the current iteration is a flaming dumpster

heroic bravado can loop rugged as long as you can keep reducing its cost (with a card like lone wolf). Hermit is acutally able to get much more value out of this relic then the downfall characters do, since he does a better job at manipulating his block.
meanwhile a character like hexaghost has block cards which automatically play for you; making it harder to intentionally take 1 damage to use this effect.
another way to do so is with snecko eye
downfall mode just not having the heart as an enemy lowers the stock of this relic a lot. Since thats the one fight in the game where you are able to fully capitalize on it pretty much every time.
IMO, it provides about the same draw as ink bottle in most circumstances
I still don't think this relic is that good even in the context of hermit, and especially in the context of rare relics
saying "it draws you a full hand vs blood shots" is overplaying this relic, AND it applies to exactly one fight in the game
I wouldn't say "oh this card is sometimes worse than puzzle" because it's ALWAYS worse than puzzle, especially since you can activate puzzle on your own turn.
rework idea: for every 3 curses in your deck, draw an additional card per turn
Now its a shop relic you dont buy 9/10 runs
i mean downfall at least has the world of goop event where you can claim three icked curses
as for the heroes... well curse synergy has always been a problem
curse synergy that requires more than 1 curse just doesn't work. The only reason why <duvu doll> isn't garbage is because ascender's bane. Without it, it's probably one of the worst relics.

embeds.title: Du-Vu Doll
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Slay the Spire

For each **Curse** in your deck, start each combat with 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.
*A doll devised to gain strength from malicious energy.*

messages.content: And almost every other curse synergy relic SUCKS. Imo unless it's on a character that explicitly has curse synergy baked into their kit (hermit, the cursed) then I don't think curse synergy relics are a good design space.
Wait I always thought duvu was uncommon.
I think if rye stalk is going to do anything with curses, it should be unique to hermit.
duvu is p much vajra with extra steps to account for sometimes you have a curse you didn’t bother to remove
I've seen a Spire clone where the Du-Vu doll equivalent gives you 1 Strength *and* Dex per curse.
if it can account for curses mid combat it’s ok
I almost always remove curses ASAP if I somehow get them, which almost never happens outside of bad Writhing Mass luck. x)
some of them are fine in more developed decks
Or you have toolkit things that ease them
if you’re guardian repulsor makes icky for example pretty whatever
Sapped is generally fine
I highly value decreasing the risk of bricking. Getting Strike/Strike/Defend/0-cost attack/curse in your opening hand sucks.
If your deck is late act1 or later you should be able to just play it like a remove
though it’s obv kinda bad into sencheese

Spending 1 energy and a draw on the first deck cycle just to... remove two bad cards for the next cycle? Seems pretty bad to me...
Better than most curses, but still...
I don't value <Purity> very highly outside of FNP/Dark Embrace stuff, and this is much worse than Purity.

embeds.title: Purity
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Slay the Spire

**Exhaust** up to 3 (5) cards in your hand.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: well depends how thin your deck is
also purity just has low chance to hit its ceilings
you’re not gonna get 5 cards you’re ok with exhausting most of the time
unless you already generate tokens to exhaust

And even then generating tokens to exhaust only has a positive interaction with Purity if you *want* to exhaust the tokens for whatever reason.
It's "up to" five cards, so if you only have three cards you want to exhaust, you can just exhaust those.
though it would also run into the issue that you’d rather just have fatal desire mostly
yes but it feels like a wasted card if you don’t have at least 2/3 or 3/5 anyway
anyway you don’t take sapped for sapped
Sure, but you shouldn't sunk cost fallacy yourself into exhausting something you should be keeping just to "avoid wasting" too much of Purity's effect. x)
you take sapped because you want the thing that gives you sapped as a side effect
like remove 2 for sapped vs remove 1
Fair, I just think you're overstating its redeeming qualities.
it’s ok and can be worked around
which is a lot better than many curses
i mean i don’t actually buy purity anyway lol

These... seem to have roughly the same value to me? In both cases it's a net -1 crappy card.
